Entries.default: A man saunters over to you with a jagged smile. He's got a long, crooked scar on his forearm, and he's rolled his sleeve up to flaunt it.

"You must be new. Lucky for you, we have a special rate for newcomers! A bag of coppers in exchange for your life."

He brandishes a knife. One of his companions grins widely enough to show you all of his missing teeth.
"Dereo the Lean will be disappointed to hear about this."
"The Huana throw troublemakers like you into the Old City. And they happen to be friends of mine."
[Crack your knuckles.] "This'll be fun."
"You're newer than I am. Which means you're poaching on someone else's territory."
[Attack] "Let's get this over with."
The thugs look at one another and exchange a few panicked whispers.
"The pit we hear all the screams coming from?"
"Told you!" One of the others punches the leader's shoulder.
They hurry off and disappear back into the crowd.
But the way they're all gathered around you, leaving their own backs exposed, tells you they haven't been here long, either.
But it's a rigid smile, and the first thug's hand is shaking. You suspect they're not as tough as they let on.
[Pay 50 cp.] "Will this satisfy you?"
"A pleasure doing business." He bows low.
"It seems we've made a mistake. Forgive and forget, no?" He smiles, backing away.
"Wait, you know him?" The man's eyes go wide in horror.
"You should know better than to cross a Bleak Walker."
"A... what?"
"Want to know what I did in my last life to get this face?"
He swallows audibly, looking at the twists and ridges of your flesh.
"How convenient. YOU just walked into MY trap."
"W-what?" He blinks.
"Obviously. This spot is perfect for an ambush - it's got few exits, distance from the guards, and plenty of drunk marks."
The thugs whisper worriedly among one another. After a brief conference, the leader gives you a wan smile.
"Here's everything. Take it!" He throws a handful of coin at your feet and takes off running. The others soon follow.
"What else would I be doing here?"
"Yep, this is my neighborhood. I'm surprised you haven't heard of me."
They're nodding along, all except the leader, who's squinting at you as if searching his memory.
"Come to think of it, we haven't heard of you. Strange, isn't it?"
They draw their weapons and rush you.
They look at each other.
"Gettin' robbed, for starters."
"I'm not looking for trouble."
"That's a real shame."
